DataElement.preferredName: MD Anderson Symptom Inventory - Core 15 Last 24 Hours Interference Mood Score 11 Point Likert Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how much symptoms interfered with mood in the last 24 hours, using an eleven-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: MD Anderson Symptom Inventory - Core Past 24 Hours Interference With Mood Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A self-administered questionnaire designed to assess multiple symptoms experienced by cancer patients and the interference with daily living caused by these symptoms._Past; before the present time._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::24_In modern usage, an hour is defined as a unit of time 60 minutes, or 3600 seconds in length. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day._The act of hindering or obstructing or impeding._Used to indicate the presence of something or someone._A relatively temporary state of feeling._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A self-administered questionnaire designed to assess multiple symptoms experienced by cancer patients and the interference with daily living caused by these symptoms.

Concepts.definition: A self-administered questionnaire designed to assess multiple symptoms experienced by cancer patients and the interference with daily living caused by these symptoms.

Property.preferredName: Past Integer::24 Hour Interference With Mood Score
Property.preferredDefinition: Past; before the present time.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::24:In modern usage, an hour is defined as a unit of time 60 minutes, or 3600 seconds in length. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.:The act of hindering or obstructing or impeding.:Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.:A relatively temporary state of feeling.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: Before the present time.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.
The act of hindering or obstructing or impeding.
Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.
A relatively temporary state of feeling.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueDomain.preferredName: MDASI Symptom Interference with Life Score 11 Point Likert Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard for the subjective scoring of a symptom's interference with life that ranges from 0: Did Not Interfere to 10: Interfered Completely.

Quality of Life Measures (Patient Reported Outcomes - Health Related Quality of Life)

ReferenceDocuments.name: MDASI User Guide
ReferenceDocuments.description: Documentation of the development and psychometric properties of the MDASI and its modules

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.
